title: Earthquake hits yakima; but storm-struck city pays no mind
author: Seattle Times Staffseattle Times News Services
text: YAKIMA - An earthquake with a magnitude of 3.7 shook the area yesterday, but folks apparently were too busy with mud, floods and other winter-storm aftermath to pay much attention.    "I didn't notice it," said Karen Allen of the Yakima Valley Office of Emergency Management.    The quake, centered about 12 miles north-northeast of Yakima, occurred about 2:25 p.m.    No injuries or damage had been reported, Allen said, though she noted that about 46 buildings had collapsed in the area since Tuesday - mostly flat-roofed fruit warehouses and other commercial sites unable to bear the weight of snow dumped by two recent winter storms. Yesterday, as rainfall began and temperatures rose, many area roads were awash.    The pattern of heavy snow followed by rain and rising temperatures moved from the west side of the state.    "Well, now it's nailing us, and we're not real appreciative," Allen told a Seattle caller. "We'd just as soon you kept it over there.
